com.epoch.chem
Class EquationFunctions

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.chem.EquationFunctions

public class EquationFunctions
extends Object

Functions that use Maxima to evaluate mathematical equations and expressions.

Method Detail

debugPrint

private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

formatExpression

public static String formatExpression(String entry)
Formats the entry for Maxima, with implicit multiplication made explicit and µ and μ converted to u.
  • If consecutive digits are preceded by beginning of line, open parenthesis, white space, comma, or semicolon and followed by zero or more space characters and then a letter, then put an asterisk between the digits and the letter.
  • Replace µ and μ with u.

Returns:
the entry formatted for Maxima

isValidExpression

public static void isValidExpression(String exprn)
                              throws ProcessExecutionException,
                                     EquationFormatException
Determines whether an expression (or equation) is valid.

Parameters:
exprn - the expression
Throws:
ProcessExecutionException - if the process can't be executed properly
EquationFormatException - if the equation's format is bad

isValidExpression

public static void isValidExpression(String exprn,
                                     boolean saveEqnInException)
                              throws ProcessExecutionException,
                                     EquationFormatException
Determines whether an expression (or equation) is valid.

Parameters:
exprn - the expression
saveEqnInException - when true and the equation is malformed, make a new error message and throw out the one from Maxima
Throws:
ProcessExecutionException - if the process can't be executed properly
EquationFormatException - if the equation's format is bad

reduce

public static String[] reduce(String calcn)
                       throws ProcessExecutionException,
                              EquationFormatException
Extracts the Maxima solution(s) from the output string.

Parameters:
calcn - the maxima calculation to run
Returns:
one or more results of the maxima calculation
Throws:
ProcessExecutionException - if the process can't be executed properly
EquationFormatException - if the result is not a reduced equation or expression

execute

public static String execute(String calcn)
                      throws ProcessExecutionException,
                             EquationFormatException
Uses Maxima to reduce an expression or to solve an equation. May give more than one solution.

Parameters:
calcn - the maxima calculation to run
Returns:
one or more results of the maxima calculation
Throws:
ProcessExecutionException - if the process can't be executed properly
EquationFormatException - if the result is not a reduced equation or expression

execute

public static String execute(String calcn,
                             boolean saveEqnInException)
                      throws ProcessExecutionException,
                             EquationFormatException
Uses Maxima to reduce an expression or to solve an equation. May give more than one solution.

Parameters:
calcn - the maxima calculation to run
saveEqnInException - when true and the equation is malformed, make a new error message and throw out the one from Maxima
Returns:
one or more results of the maxima calculation
Throws:
ProcessExecutionException - if the process can't be executed properly
EquationFormatException - if the result is not a reduced equation or expression

separateMagnitudePrefix

public static String separateMagnitudePrefix(String unit)
Converts the magnitude prefix of a unit into the power of ten times the base unit.

Parameters:
unit - a unit that may have a magnitude prefix
Returns:
the power of ten times the base unit
